title: NEW CLIENT IS BUGGY
body:
Got new client, played a game for 15 min, tabbed out (still in-game), tabbed back in, game crashed, close window, click 'reconnect', game crashes again

Restarted clinet, nope still would crash.

Am I in fault and should I even be suspended for this bug that occurs all the sudden after updating client??? Before this updating, I never had this incident occur and here I am.

My PC:
Processor - AMD Ryzen 5 2600 Six-Core Processor 3.40 Ghz
RAM - 8 GB
System type - 64-bit operating sysmte, x64-based processor
Windows 10 Pro

replies.body:
So it isn't actually a new client, just a new login flow that's updated to include the "stay logged in" feature and with background updates to later support things like 2fa and other games. The client itself is still the same.

In saying that however, the rollouts of the new login flow coincide with the regular patches, so it's possible you had a bad patch. This can occur for a variety of reasons, connection instability being the main (but not only) culprit.

Depending on your graphics card, alt-tabbing can be quite unstable in general if you play in true fullscreen, particularly if you do so in loading. As a band-aid fix I'd recommend switching to windowed fullscreen or not alt-tabbing in-game.

More permanently, the first thing you should try is a client repair (Settings > Initiate Full Repair). Failing that, a clean reinstall will fix just about anything local, you can do this quickly and easily via the [Hextech Repair Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool), but naturally, you'll have to re-download the game.

If all else fails, ticket Player Support and they'll be able to help you further: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
